titleStmt.title: By the King, a declaration having already signified our pleasure to call a Parliament .. it is our royal purpose to endeavour a legal establishement of an universal liberty of conscience for all our subjects ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1685-1688 : James II)
James II, King of England, 1633-1701.

notesStmt.note: "Given at our court at Whtehall [sic], the one and twentieth day of September, 1688, in the fourth year of our reign."
Second part of title taken from first nine lines of text.
Reproduction of original in the University of Illinois (Urbana-Champaign Campus). Library.
